intro: Agoseris dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are generally gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and somewhat woody. The flower heads consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray flowers, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
